classSpec.desc: attributes for component elements of temporal expressions involving dates and time

attDef.desc: supplies the value of a date or time in a standard form.
attDef.valDesc: Any string representing a date in any of the standard formats recommended as W3C schema datatypes or a duration.

remarks.p: The forms available for use are also defined in ISO 8601:2000(E), Data elements and interchange formats — Information interchange — Representation of dates and times. These include YYYY-MM-DD for full dates; HH:MM:SS.SSS for full times; --MM-DD for month and day; YY-MM for year and month.

attDef.desc: characterizes the element in some sense, using any convenient classification scheme or typology.
attDef.valDesc: any string of characters. The range of permissible values is application dependent.

attDef.desc: indicates whether the date element is given in full, as an abbreviation or simply as an initial

valItem.gloss: the temporal expression is spelled out in full.
the temporal expression is given in an abbreviated form.

remarks.p: In providing a regularized form, no claim is made that the form in the source text is incorrect; the regularized form is simply that chosen as the main form for purposes of unifying variant forms under a single heading.
